Pre-Game Insights: Ireland face a fourth defeat on the spin, with no goals scored and seven conceded in the last three.
On paper, Ireland boasts a superior squad, with transfermarkt.com estimating a difference of almost €150 million in transfer value.
Hallgrímsson expressed surprise recently at the media scrutiny since his arrival in Dublin, where he has been forced to stay at the Castleknock Hotel due to difficulties finding a property to rent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hallgrímsson is working to “stop the bleeding” while his assistant coach John O’Shea believes the commentary around players is “too derogatory”.
Collins admitted to being “sick” of the team’s inability to stop the slide towards their worst ever world ranking of 70th.
Pukki has Robbie Keane-like numbers in the international game, scoring 42 goals from 123 caps.
Others: The Nations League trip to Finland marks the formal beginning of an international partnership between Heimir Hallgrímsson and Nathan Collins.
The return of Josh Cullen from injury and Jayson Molumby’s performance last month against Greece, could provide the combinations that squeeze out a result, even a draw, to slow the downward spiral.
